solution_line_template: Harper collected {harper_more_percent_num}% more than Maggie's {maggie_candy} pieces of candy, so she collected {harper_more_percent_decimal}*{maggie_candy} = <<{harper_more_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{maggie_candy}={harper_more_candy}>>{harper_more_candy} more pieces of candy

Maggie has {maggie_candy} pieces and Harper collected {harper_more_candy} more than her, so she has {maggie_candy}+{harper_more_candy} = <<{maggie_candy}+{harper_more_candy}={harper_total_candy}>>{harper_total_candy} pieces of candy
Neil collected {neil_more_percent_num}% more than Harper, who has {harper_total_candy} pieces, so that's {neil_more_percent_decimal}*{harper_total_candy} = {neil_more_candy} more pieces of candy

Harper has {harper_total_candy} pieces and Neil collected {neil_more_candy} more than her, so he has {harper_total_candy}+{neil_more_candy} = <<{harper_total_candy}+{neil_more_candy}={neil_total_candy}>>{neil_total_candy} pieces of candy
